FuncDef:
The ssh client hmac command configures HMAC authentication algorithms on an SSH client.
The undo ssh client hmac command restores the default HMAC authentication algorithms on an SSH client. The ssh client hmac command configures HMAC authentication algorithms on an SSH client. The undo ssh client hmac command restores the default HMAC authentication algorithms on an SSH client. By default,
CLIs: ssh client hmac { md5 | md5_96 | sha1 | sha1_96 | sha2_256 | sha2_256_96 | sha2_512 | sm3 }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an HMAC MD5 authentication algorithm.
-

Specifies an HMAC SHA1 algorithm. This algorithm is recommended.
-

Specifies an HMAC SHA2_256_96 authentication algorithm.
-

Specifies an HMAC SHA2_512 authentication algorithm.
-

Specifies an HMAC SM3 authentication algorithm.
-

ExtraInfo: To configure HMAC authentication algorithms on an SSH client, run the ssh client hmac command. The SSH client and server negotiate authentication algorithms for the packets exchanged between them. During negotiation, the client sends its authentication algorithms to the server. After comparing the received authentication algorithms with local ones, the server selects the first matching authentication algorithm received for packet transmission. If no matching authentication algorithm is found, the negotiation fails.
